result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul J Freeman

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Paul J Freeman in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Paul J Freeman.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. State is still waiting on blood results. Defendant is pursuing treatment. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on September 1st, 2022

Defendant Paul J Freeman in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Paul J Freeman.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. State is waiting on blood results to come back before an offer can be given to Defense.
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Paul J Freeman in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has not retained private counsel. Court held colloquy with defendant and instructed defendant to provide a list of attorneys contacted at the next court date.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 13.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with TSE (10/28/1993),; TCM (02/27/2012),; QPP (8/18/2015),; QBP (11/18/2016),;
No Contact Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.   Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Paul J Freeman in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Paul J Freeman in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Paul J Freeman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty. DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  
 This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
